context_bundle.summary: Cognitive psychology foundations: attention (selective, divided, sustained), perception (top-down/bottom-up processing), working memory (Baddeley model), cognitive load theory, dual-process theory (System 1/2).

onboarding.quick_start: Attention is the bottleneck. Working memory ~4 chunks. Cognitive load = intrinsic + extraneous + germane. System 1 = fast/automatic, System 2 = slow/deliberate.
common_patterns: Selective attention: Cocktail party effect, inattentional blindness, change blindness
Working memory: Phonological loop (verbal), visuospatial sketchpad (visual), central executive (control)
Cognitive load: Reduce extraneous, manage intrinsic, optimize germane for learning
Dual-process: System 1 heuristics cause biases, System 2 override requires effort/motivation
known_errors: Assuming attention is unlimited - it's a finite resource
Overloading working memory - chunking helps but has limits
Ignoring cognitive load in design - leads to poor UX/learning
Over-relying on System 2 - causes decision fatigue
